intro: Hieracium uczanssuense, commonly known as the Polish hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium uczanssuense is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
